Text: Collis (plural: colles, from the Latin word for "hill") is a small hill or knob on a celestial body.
Triplets:<Collis
1:
--------------------
<Text: Collis (planetary nomenclature):  The term is used in planetary nomenclature: it is a part of international proper names of such features.>
Triplets:<Collis
2:
--------------------
Text: Collis (planetary nomenclature):  Like other generic terms, it is capitalized and stands after the proper name (for example, "Bilbo Colles"; the only exception is "Colles Nili" on Mars).
Triplets:<Collis
3:
--------------------
<Text: Collis (planetary nomenclature):  As of 2015, only groups of the hills have names, and the term is used only in plural.>
Triplets:<Collis
